messages.title: Conservatives hit local schools with ‘eye-watering’ cuts
messages.content: Ian Stotesbury fights cuts to school budgets. Schools in the Watford area are facing extreme cuts with the free government paying almost £1.8m less by 2019 than they were in 2015, affecting local schools significantly.

messages.title: Stop the dementia tax
messages.content: Liberal Democrats are leading the fight against Conservative plans to make older people pay more for care via a 'dementia tax'. Lib Dems will invest in health and social care.

messages.title: Everyone knows Labour can't win
messages.content: Labour are too weak to deliver real change. They are a strong opposition locally but there is no realistic chance nationwide.

messages.title: You can change the country
messages.content: A strong opposition with the Lib Dems can prevent NHS cuts. Conservatives are leading NHS cuts to hospitals and more towards heading into the uncertainty of Brexit.

messages.title: Stop free school meals being cut
messages.content: Conservatives are planning to stop free school meals which will negatively impact many children.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Fighting cuts to school budgets and opposing the cessation of free school meals.
Opposing the 'dementia tax' and investing in health and social care services.
Opposing further cuts to the NHS funding and services by providing strong opposition.

mentions.tacticalSituation: Labour can't win locally, so a vote for the Labour candidate would not result in a change.

issues.education: Cuts to school budgets, free school meals
issues.health: Stop the dementia tax, NHS spending cuts

endorsements.endorsement: 'Conservatives could lose up to 30 seats to Liberal Democrats at next election, secret polling reveals.'
'Labour face election bloodbath as a QUARTER of MPs face losing their seats.'
